Posts.Content: Mandy and I are going to the Provenge facility in seal beach California on July 9th. I don't really know what we will be doing but I guess we will find out soon. The people of Dendreon are really just wonderful people. Everyone I have ever met has their own reason for doing what they do but I can assure you they all put we patients first. It will be good to see old friends and make new ones. Todd

Posts.Content: Hi Sailor, I have been employed at a paper mill in Longview for 20 years. It use to be called Longview Fibre Company. Prior to that I worked at Weyerhaeuser for 20 years. My wife and I make it to the gorge a couple times a year to watch the kite boarders and wind surfers. I never got into that but love waterskiing and wakeboarding. We still take our sleds up to Mt. St. Helens and tear it up as often as possible but there is no snow this year. I grew up in Castle Rock but moved up the Highway to Toutle a dozen years ago. Thanks for the reply.

Posts.Title: Calling no more lupron for me.

Posts.Content: I have been off of Zytiga a little over 4 months. I have no recent PSA data to report. My next blood draw is still a few months away. I could have a PSA but why? I am cancer free until told otherwise. On other fronts, morning glory and spontaneous erections are now a regular occurrence. Urine flow is normal. I did get up to pee 3x the last 2 nights but I have been sleeping poorly due to shoulder pain. Once I wake up, my brain wont let me go back to sleep until I pee. I still feel really good. I have a healthy appetite. My body chemistry is changing as the effects of Lupron wane. I am cold a lot. I never thought I would wish for a hot flash. In a little over 2 months I will celebrate 13 years since diagnosis. I am back to work these last 2 weeks since orthoscopic surgery on my knee. My knee feels fantastic. I wish my shoulder felt the same. I had a cortisone shot on Wednesday to try and aleviate the pain. I see an MRI and shoulder surgery in my future.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years. Posts.Title: Journey update

Posts.Content: Oh I get it and to be honest, I am tooting my own horn a little. I only found out last night. My heart is for advocacy. My goal is to inspire guys who are late stage to live their lives out loud inspite of terminal diagnosis. I will never be one of the cured. Damnit. So i write about my life with cancer and share it to everyone I can reach. Hope is the greatedt weapon in a stage IV arsenal.
Posts.Title: #healthevoices16

Posts.Content: My goal in life is to reach as many late-stage survivors as I can. When it comes to surgery and incontinence and penal rehab and all the stuff that the surgery guys have gone through I've got nothing. I have never experienced any of them. Cancer changed my life. Everybody is going to die but not everybody truly lives. So if I can get people to go to my blog and see a 10-year stage 4 prostate cancer survivor water skiing like a Maniac or jumping off a rope swing as high as a four-storey building or snowmobiling up the side of Mount st. Helens and that helps them realize that prostate cancer does not have to stop them from living life out loud that's what I want to do. I know that one day this disease will kill me. But I'm not going out without a fight. And if I can Inspire others to do the same then I have done my job. I apologize in advance for any typos on this post. I am allowing my phone to dictate for me and Siri sometimes just doesn't speak the same language as I

Posts.Title: The good stuff

Posts.Content: It has been almost 6 months since dad passed away. It has been a hard six months. My mom and dad had been together since my mom was 14 years old and they married shortly after she graduated from high school. She has lost her very best friend in the world. When my band formed in 1996 my brother played bass and my dad played rhythm guitar. Although dad quit playing a couple years ago losing him kind of took the wind out of our sails. We have practiced a few times since his passing but it's hard to find the motivation to book a gig. Dad only lived 4 months from the time he was diagnosed. He never had the opportunity to take a trip or do any of the things he would have liked to do. The slope was slippery and dad couldn't find his footing. Taken 6 months before he passed! We love you dad!! I love the song "The Good Stuff" by Kenny Chesney. It is the story of a guy who goes to the bar after his first marital spat and asks for the good stuff. The old bar keeper pours him a glass of milk and they sit and chat about all the good stuff in love and life. The song hits home at the moment and I am somewhat teary eyed as I write. I have said many times that this disease changed my life for the better. The truth is that this disease caused me to be like my dad always was. My dad was an everyday hero. He worked hard, provided for his family, and he was always the guy who would answer the phone at 2:00 a.m. and be there for a friend. They just don't make men like dad anymore. It has been 9 years, 11 months, and 7 days since my diagnosis. I don't often talk about my life before cancer. The reason for that is there is really not much good to tell. Four years prior to my diagnosis I had lost everything to drug addiction. A three-year addiction to methamphetamine caused me to lose my home and everything I valued. 10 months prior to my diagnosis I was living in somebody else's garage. During that dark time in my life I thought I wanted to die. I even attempted suicide. Oddly enough the day I tried to kill myself, August 20, 2005. Was the last day I ever used. A month after getting clean I could afford to activate my cell phone. After activating it I changed my voicemail. It went something like this. " Hi, you have reached Todd. I have been making some changes in my life. If I don't call you back, consider yourself part of that change!" My path to the good stuff started August 21, 2005! It has been nothing but good stuff ever since. I met my wife in December of 05, the weekend after my birthday. She knew the day we met that we would be together. It took me a couple months longer to figure it out. I have never claimed to be bright! Our life together is the good stuff that I speak of. It's not always easy. Cancer took away a great deal of out intimacy but not all of it. Our life is filled with friend, family, and adventure. We collect memories instead of collecting things. I am blessed that even after 10 years of cancer, I can still go to work every day. Our jobs provide us the ability to travel wherever we want to go. It's a wonderful life. Often when faced with darkness and unable to see the light ahead, despair causes people to lose hope and give up. It happened to me. I gave up. Had it not been for a guardian angel I might not be here to experience the blessing my life has become. It just goes to show that even during the darkest of nights, the sun will rise in the morning. We only have to hang in there until it does. There is hope! Hold on to the good stuff!

Posts.Title: The good stuff

Posts.Content: Hi guys, Thank you for the replies. I am a rich man. I just don't have a lot of money )) It is actually very easy to tell my story. I believe that I have done well against this disease for a reason. I tell my story whenever I can to anyone who will listen. It is why I blog and do public speaking. If my story can inspire hope in others even just one other then it is worth it. It is a pleasure to be here.

Posts.Title: The good stuff

Posts.Content: Mandy and I returned Tuesday evening from seal Beach California where we toured the Provenge manufacturing facility and learned benefits and health the treatment is made. We had an awesome time and we're completely fascinated by the entire process. I received Provenge four years ago after a long battle where we had to appeal all the way to the Washington state insurance commissioner . Ultimately we were successful and I received for avenge between May and June 2012. It's a choice I'm really happy I made. I wrote in greater detail about the experience on my blog and so far I haven't been able to figure out how to get my blog address and my signature. I'm not trying to take people away from the site as my blog only gets written on a few times a month but if anybody wants to read more about the experience you may do so at toddseals63.blogspot.com

Posts.Title: Provenge and Dendreon and a tour of the manufacturing facility

Posts.Content: I don't know where you're getting your information. The cost for provenge is approximately 140,000 for all three infusions. Insurance covers usually most of it My 3 infusions were 131k and I paid 75 out of pocket. Provenge gave me 17 side effect free, progression free months as well as the knowledge that Zytiga is working better because of it. I was diagnosed stage4 with a one year prognosis. Provenge just makes sense.

Posts.Title: Um! Just sharing.

Posts.Content: Wednesday last, I celebrated my 12 year anniversary of diagnosis metastatic PCa. I continue to remain undetectable. Not too bad. There have been subtle changes lately. Twelve years in Lupron and 5 years on Zytiga should have ended any possibility of physical intimacy but I am beginning to have a slight Libido and I have full function. Since starting ADT 12 years ago I have not needed deodorant or antiperspirant. Now occasionally I will pit out. All in all things are good. There is hope men. Todd

Posts.Title: Just Joined the forum

Posts.Content: Hi Pat, Helluva ride. I became ill the summer of my 42nd year. Stage 4 widespread metastasis. I am in year 10. The anniversary of my diagnosis is June 6. I am undetectable. I have been on hormones 9 of the last 10 years. I don't have any libido but in the last couple of years the hanger has returned. I am a couple decades younger than you but don't lose hope. Over time the body adjusts
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years. Hormone vacation 1 year. Back on Lupron and then 6 months on DES Chest radiated to avoid going from an A-cup to a B-cup. Hormone Refractory November 2011 Provenge/Lupron/Casodex May 2012. Started Zytiga+Lupron August 2013 and I am currently still on it. Current PSA <0.02 Current scans are clean. Since beginning hormones 10 years ago I have added chick flicks and shoe shopping to my hobby list.
Posts.Title: Long Windy Road

Posts.Content: That is really great news. I did not know it could be measured that low
Posts.Title: Well got some good news yesterday

Posts.Content: Just a note to say hello! Still here, still doing well. 37 months on Zytiga and as of last month my PSA is Still undetectable.

Posts.Title: Blog post on biopsy

Posts.Content: My wife is younger than I. 15 years younger to be exact. I don't know if that makes my lucky or a pervert�� I don't have a Libido but I love my wife.I refuse to allow my lack of desire to steal the joy of intimacy from her. It has not been easy and trust my, there has been a steep learning curve but it has been worth it. Once I learned to let emotions and her pleasure be my source of arousal and also learned to get out of my own head and stop worrying if it was big enough or hard enough things started working. It happened when we went on a cruise and I forgot to pack the Trimix. Turns out I didn't need it
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years. Posts.Title: Blog post on biopsy

Posts.Content: I have been on ADT now for 10 years. I have adjusted to the new normal. For a while intimacy with my wife was next to impossible without Trimix but as time went on I learned to get out of my head and focus on the emotional part of physical intimacy. We still only make love once a week but I no longer need E.D. Medication as long as my focus is on her.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years. Posts.Title: Blog post on biopsy

Posts.Content: I am sorry it has been so long. I have been so busy. Yeas I am still here. The cancer is undetectable. My last PSA >0.01 I am thriving. I waterski and wakeboard. I downhill ski and put 70 miles a week on my mountain bike. I hike and kayak an ran a 10k last year. Thats not so much though. I use to marathon. I will try to be around more. Soon the Home remodel will be finished and I can relax
Posts.Title: Interview with cure magazine podcast link

Posts.Content: HinFIrwind. I turn 53 next Friday. I have a 3k max out of pocket per calendar year. I put about $1500 a year into a health savings account. I will usually max out my out of pocket expenses in January. After that, my healthcare is free. I still work as a pipefitter and machine lube tech1 50 Hours a week or more. I. Believe Provenge has had a huge effect on my overall survival. Fighting to get Provenge was one of the best moves I ever did. Provenge had no side effects. I hear some folks have them but I was not one of them. Easy-peasy. I did sleep 24 hours after my first infusion. I guess that could be a side effect. I also could have been tired.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years. Posts.Title: Hi guys

Posts.Content: It's been a while since I logged on. I have been busy busy busy. Home remodeling, elk hunting, Christmas shopping, and overtime have taken a toll on my advocacy work. The blogger app on my phone crashed and I was unable to blog for nearly a month. On the cancer front I am doing well. 10 years 5 months and 16days since my stage 4 diagnosis. Open enrollment this year has saw a change in insurance. I no longer have my Kaiser healthcare but have transitioned to Blue Cross. This change will allow me to see an expert Oncologist at Providence Cancer Center. Life is a wonderful gift. I tried to post a couple hunting pics but the upload was unsuccessful. If anyone wants to see them they are on my blog at toddseals63.blogspot.com Not trying to plug my blog just couldn't upload the pics here.

Posts.Title: Hi guys

Posts.Content: I am heading into month 122 since my stage 4 diagnosis. Yesterday's PSA less than 0.02. Keep in mind guys my original Psa was over 3000 with widespread Mets and a 1 year prognosis. It can be done. Life is good! Live it loud!!!

Posts.Title: Month 122 update

Posts.Content: I am not around much. I stop in from time to time and read posts but rarely reply. Prostate cancer is the very best thing to ever happen to me. It changed my life 90% for the better. There once was a time I wanted to die. Maybe that is why I got sick. Getting sick showed me how much I wanted to live and also how I wasted my 1st 42 years. I no longer waste my life. Thank you PCa. You caused my life to have meaning and depth. That is my perspective
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years. Posts.Title: It's all perspective

Posts.Content: Hi Bro, Sorry about your luck but you are on the right road. I completed Provenge June 1st 20012. I was diagnosed Stage 4 2006 with a psa of 3200+ With lymph, lung, and bone Metastasis. Castration resistant 2011. Provenge is the real deal. I took some second line hormone after Provenge to lower my psa but nothing but Lupron for 17 months after. I have been on Zytiga for 4 years now. I write a blog about my journey. You can get more details on my Provenge journey at toddseals63.blogspot.com Email me if you Want to chat
Posts.Title: Provenge?

Posts.Content: Uh no! I was ther mid April and my dad was born in Rockford. I was born and raised in Washington state and still live 25 miles from where I was born. I have some good friends in the mid west though. Hoping to head to the U.P. This winter for some extreme snowmobiling with my friend Yoop. Time will tell

Posts.Title: Provenge?

Posts.Content: Provenge is pretty easy. The hardest part is keeping your arms still for the 4 hours it takes to collect the cells. I am told it is easier with a port but also there is a greater risk of infection. I had zero side effects except after my first infusion I was wiped. Slept for 24 hours. Xtandi will be approved....... no worries!
Posts.Title: Provenge?

Posts.Title: Provenge?

Posts.Content: Yep, yesterday was the 10 year mark. Being diagnosed on 666 seemed ominous at first but here I am 10 years later and so far so good. On my diagnosis day I cracked open the bible ( not being preachy. We find inspiration and peace where we know to look ) pointed at the page and read a sentence that became my mantra. I will not quote it but if anyone wants to know what I read simply IM me and I will share it. I wrote a blog post on my 10 year anniversary as well. I love to write. Any of you guys who are freaked out and scared about the future I get it. I was too. I am proof that Advanced PCa does not have to be a death sentence. For you fortunate cured guys who are struggling to retain continence and deal with ED I will quote Jeff Probst of Survivor. "I got nothing for you" smiles and laughter to all.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years. Posts.Title: 10 year Anniversary

Posts.Content: Seacock. My lab used to only go down to less than 0.05. Anything less was considered undetectable. My lab went to a more ultra sensitive test last month and now my psa is >0.02 and anything less is considered undetectable. It all depends on the lab brother. I would have to say you are fine as frogs hair
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 6/6/6 Stage IV PCa widespread metastasis Gleason 3+4=7 Psa 3216.32. Metastatic to lungs lymph bones and brain. Initial prognosis 1 year. Lupron Casodex 3-1/2 years.
